embeds.title: Glittering Gambit
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 0 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

**Snekproof.**
Gain -10 (0) - 30 Gold :p_gold:.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: wooo rng!

+10 or +15 gold on average for the cost of 1 draw is amazing and it can get even better with Just Lucky or Exhume. Hand of Greed gives 20/25 but costs 2 energy and needs a convinient target, but this is just play and forget. Imho, it might need a slight nerf.
upgrade averages to +5 gold
I definitely don't think it needs a nerf. It is a scaling card on a character that already scales well, it doesn't help much in act 1, the time snecko actually needs help.
You take this usually in decks that are already doing well and it makes them do slightly better.

rng metascaling
WOOHOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!1111!!!
Oh yes, this is a "win more" card. I suppose that does limit its use
HoG is also a good damage so its not very fair to compare

I think snecko as a whole needs some reworks, and this card may be nerfed slightly in a hypothetical rework, but I would definitely not consider this to be that problematic in the grand scheme of things when it comes to snecko
I really like snecko and I agree this is not the card I would prioritise reworking
I think there are much bigger fish to fry when it comes to snecko
mud shield..
Like ??? cards as a whole, rng cards as a whole, many snecko cards have awful numbers for no reason, exotic form

I think ??? cards being random is fine, but the snecko's own cards should bring more stability to the deck rather than less, so that you don't rely entirely on being lucky (even if that's kind of the arechetype)

a bit offtopic but snecko has quite a few cards which focus on Offbrands and I think giving more options for transforming cards mid-combat would be good - a way to change your bad cards into something potentially less bad.

I don't think the way ??? cards work makes for a fun or consistent character. You can't actually craft your deck in a deckbuilder, and the categories are too vague. Strength can give you <spot weakness> but it could also give you <liquidate>. That is a bit of an extreme example, but a ton of small ones like that makes it impossible to build a deck and add things that make the deck better, since the deck is drastically different each combat.

embeds.title: Spot Weakness
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

If the enemy intends to attack, gain 3 (4) **Strength** :p_strength:.

embeds.title: Liquidate
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 0 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

**Unplayable** if you have negative **Strength** :p_strength:.
Lose 2 **Strength** :p_strength:.
Gain 2 (3) **Potency** :p_potency:.

messages.content: A proposed rework for them is that they still show up as ??? in card rewards, but when you choose one it opens up another 3 card choice and you must take one of those 3 cards and add it to your deck. It still has inherent risk, and it still can screw you, but at least you know in what ways you are screwed so you can build around it.
seems there are 3 different ideas

Identifying cards should totally become a more accesible thing, so you can make a more coherent synergy. Right now snecko relies a lot on playing high-value cards that don't synergise well - snecko really likes cards like Bludgeon and Unlimited Power, rather than Catalyst
this idea, SamLL's idea of "it randomizes upon draw", and Evab's idea of mass category changing
(does the hexaghost work with snecko now? i don't recall)
kind of
Still the same concept, but it lets you actually add cards to your deck. Currently taking a ??? card is basically adding the vague idea of whatever the category is.
Adding more specific categories sounds promising
Like 2-cost block cards
explicit ignites work, but obviously you don’t get full wheel and i think certain number of cards are banned
so like many other chars in “snecko uses it worse”
afterlife is quite strong there though
there's a reason why the Holy Trinity for snecko is IC Hexa Collector

The way I imagine snecko as a character is being able to set up insane cross-class combos like after image frost orb juggernaut, or guardian's temp buffs with determination. The way it plays currently is take random stuff and muddle it until it costs 0 or 1.
I agree with you, snecko should be supporting those cross-class synergies
don’t forget transform not random stuff into random stuff and random stuff into cheaper random stuff
and “play random stuff for card draw”
I think making identifying better is a path that could be taken, I think it could work. Not my first choice personally, but honestly anything in the right direction is good for me.

perhaps there could be a bunch of cards that are only available when you pick certain combos of classes, and those native snecko cards would enable easier synergising.
there isn't a lot of synergy between an Ironclad and Bronze Automaton, so how about a card or two which might make them work together better?
typically i make maybe 1-3 ids per run on snecko right now assuming no egg
or early hammer also makes me id more
don't forget shitting out random crap
imo the main issue is that outside of random stuff snecko is just really bad numbers in a trenchcoat
so you have no reliability unless you play snecko as world’s shittiest prismatic shard

Cool concept, but I feel like it would add a lot of unnecessary complexity. You'd need a way to explain all of this to the player, and makes experiencing all of snecko way too weird. Also it's a lot of work to do for every character combo, and cards get reworked
also ic actually has auto synergy
not a very good example, you could make a status deck with clad and automaton, but the idea is there
evolve alone
and prismatic shard is already not great
auto is just bad bc encode relies on density of encode cards to be good
since auto’s status package is quite limited and functions are the core mechanic

alternatively, if we want reliability, how about you get 1 specific starter card for each selected class? Those cards would be aimed as cross-synergy, although the contents may be hard to balance. If you pick auto, you could get a card which encodes normally unencodable cards (with limits), allowing for some shenanigans.
perhaps synergy at the start is not a good idea..
... or get a virus
Im in the camp saying that Unid cards need some kind of major rework before Snecko can work as intended, because right now taking any of them shoots you in the foot
What that rework is,  I  don't know
My idea was that each unid card would pick 3 cards from the relevant pool when the game offers you the card, preview all 3 on mouseover, and switch only between those cards
So it has some variance but you can know for certain that it'll do something you want, or you just don't take it
And instead of iding, you can replace one option with a different random card as a free action once per rest site
In case you see, like, wraith form alternating with something useless
i hate that discussions are being used up by snecko because everyone already knows snecko is broken already

what is up guys today we're going to discuss snecko reworks for the 17th time this time featuring a completely untraceable channel for further reference and a lack of investment in conversation overall

One of the easier ways in STS to metascale, since it costs 0 in combat and is even snekproof. Far less hassle than something like wish, though it doesn't offer any utility beyond gaining gold. You do also need to spend gold at a shop or take this over other rares at a boss reward, and that can be a bit difficult considering that this doesn't do anything in the actual combat you draw it in, though snecko usually can get enough card draw to support a card like this. Definitely better than skipping, but it won't help you deal hallways/elites going into act 2, or build a more cohesive gameplan. Upgrade is fine, I can appreciate never actively losing gold from casting this. Can be funny with strange spoon if you want to try that, and plays well with ink bottle/letter opener/dead branch to help it have more impact.

As for snecko overall, I do think that most of the issue comes from ??? cards making actual deckbuilding near impossible, as you have no idea what your deck does now, which makes it very difficult to figure out which cards to take to improve it's gameplan/consistency/strategic holes. That's a huge deal in a deckbuilder, and makes playing the character a massive headache, especially considering that you start with two unidentified basics (which are usually high priority removes than even strike/defend), and that you often need to take a few unidentified cards to help clear act 1 elites. Right now, optimal snecko play requires checking your entire draw pile at the start of every fight to check what your unidentified cards rolled into and attempt to find a winning strategy for that fight based on that information, which is pretty miserable. Frozen eye is a shop relic because not every player likes dealing with that level of planning in order to be optimal and effective.
Yeah I think most people are there, I also think the rng cards need to show you the stats before you play them.
I kinda like it, it's one of the few things the server agrees on, and also seeing everyone's ideas is cool
well I find we generally agree on what characters are poorly designed
it's like the meme format with people at a round table having a peaceful discussion and people at a beach fighting
still waiting for the Nic200 vs. Blue Guy fight lol
You're here
seems Blue Guy is busy rn
this card is fine
its

I don't care about it
